p: Family physicians spend about 10 % of their time caring for children. About two-thirds of practicing family physicians report that they provide care for children [ 1]. Thus, the family physicianâ€™s role in early proper management of infections is of paramount importance. Office visits must concentrate on clinical evaluation and diagnosis, appropriate management and advice, and prevention and early detection of complications. In this chapter, the clinical presentations, differential diagnosis, and management of common acute infectious diseases in children will be discussed.
